ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English policie, from Old French police ('civil administration, government'), from Latin politia ('government, administration'), from Greek politeia ('citizenship, government, constitution').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun, can be countable (referring to a specific rule) or uncountable (referring to the general concept of planning)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by a government, party, business, or individual.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 政策；方针；指导原则；行动准则。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new economic policy aims to reduce unemployment.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新的经济政策旨在减少失业。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A contract of insurance; a document detailing the terms and conditions of an insurance agreement.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Make sure you read the fine print on your auto insurance policy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 确保你仔细阅读了汽车保险单上的细则。
